awd_titl_txt: COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH:  Mechanics of Footwall Uplift DuringDetachment Faulting:  A Field Test of Kinematic and Dynamic Models
awd_abstract_narration: Isostatic uplift of denuded footwall rocks beneath a                       shallowly-dipping detachment fault is thought to cause upwards                  arching of the detachment and may cause the shallow past of the                 fault to be abandoned.  This theory predicts that as fault slip                 continues, the hinge zone between steep, active and shallow,                    inactive parts of the fault will migrate through the footwall.                  Alternative models predict different strain paths will be recorded              in the footwall rocks.  This study will test the hypothesis of a                migrating hinge zone by examining the strain state in footwall                  rocks beneath three detachment faults from different tectonic                   settings:  Beaver Dam Mountains, Utah; Whipple Mountains,                       California; and Brenner Line, eastern Alps.  The results will allow             assessment of the migrating hinge models and will have broad                    applicability to extensional zones in a variety of tectonic                     environments.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
